SENT.plain: A 3-month-old boy with Costello syndrome (CS) developed respiratory distress and fatal arrhythmias
An autopsy showed cardiac hypertrophy, mild coarctation of the aorta, and pancreatic islet cell hyperplasia
To our knowledge, this is the first report of a pancreatic abnormality in CS
Islet cell hyperplasia has also been observed in leprechaunism, Beckwith-Wiedemann (BWS), and Simpson-Golabi-Behmel syndromes
The syndromes are thought to involve abnormal insulin or insulin-like growth factor (IGF) pathways
Clinical similarities among these disorders and CS, together with the finding of islet cell hyperplasia, suggest that they may be related
